coreCitation.title: LMEC Historic Boston Shoreline
coreCitation.briefDescription: Standardized boundaries of historic shoreline; geography covers the City of Boston and parts of Cambridge, Somerville, Chelsea and Winthrop; time period covers 1630-present in a series of temporal snapshots
coreCitation.fullNotes:
**What**: This dataset represents the extents of Boston's historic shoreline 
 
 **Where:** This dataset covers the City of Boston and includes some parts of Cambridge, Somerville, Chelsea and Winthrop 
 
 **When:** This data is structured as temporal snapshots capturing the extent at different years. 
 The years included in the dataset are: 
 
 - 1635 
 - 1795 
 - 1852 
 - 1880 
 - 1916 
 - 1934 
 - 1950 
 - 1995 
 - the present day 
 
 **Why:** Different versions of this data have existed in the past, digitally 'hand-drawn' by cartographers creating maps for print publications. The datasets used to create these maps until now haven't been archived in GIS-compatible formats. This LMEC-maintained dataset is a stable, standardized GIS boundary file of historic shoreline extents. 
 
 **Who:** The LMEC has standardized and preserved data submitted by cartographers working on the Atlas of Boston History book project.
coreCitation.accessCondition: This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use.

dataEndpoints.title: Boston Historic Shoreline Land Extent GeoJSON
Boston Historic Shoreline Water Extent GeoJSON

temporal.temporalNotes: This data represents the historic state of the Boston shoreline in the year 1995. It was digitally derived in 2019 from born-digital maps published in 1995.

publishedWorks.title: All Over the Map: How Boston Made Itself Bigger
publishedWorks.author: Betsy Mason

ingredients.notes: This source data, which contained separate files for each year, was consolidated and cleaned up into singular land and water files

maintenance.maintenanceFrequency: This dataset is not frequently updated
